sen.j: 日本 > 近畿地方 > 京都府 > 綴喜郡
sen.e: Japan>Kinki region>Kyoto Prefecture>Tsuzuki-gun
Japan>Kinki region>Kyoto Prefecture>Tsuzuki county
Japan>Kinki region>Kyoto Prefecture>Tsuzuki county

sen.j: 令制国一覧 > 畿内 > 山城国 > 綴喜郡
sen.e: List of provinces of Japan>Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) >Yamashiro Province>Tsuzuki-gun
List of provinces of Japan>Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) >Yamashiro Province>Tsuzuki county
List of provinces of Japan>Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) >Yamashiro Province>Tsuzuki county

sen.j: 綴喜郡（つづきぐん、つづきのこおり）は、京都府・山城国の郡である。
sen.e: Tsuzuki-gun (or tsuzuki-no-kori) is a country of Yamashiro Province in Kyoto Prefecture.
Tsuzuki county (or tsuzuki-no-kori) is a county of Yamashiro Province in Kyoto Prefecture.
Tsuzuki county (or tsuzuki-no-kori) is a county of Yamashiro Province in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 現在は以下の2町を含む。
sen.e: Following two towns are included at present:
Following two towns are included at present:
Following two towns are included at present:

sen.j: 井手町（いでちょう）
sen.e: Ide-cho
Ide-cho
Ide-cho

sen.j: 宇治田原町（うじたわらちょう）
sen.e: Ujitawara-cho
Ujitawara-cho
Ujitawara-cho

sen.j: - 郡区町村編制法に基づき田辺村に綴喜郡役所を設置。
sen.e: Based on Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), the Tsuzuki-gun public office was placed in Tanabe-mura Village.
sen.cmt: この文章のみ、「田辺村」は「Tanabe-mura Village」としました。
sen.e: Based on Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), the Tsuzuki county public office was placed in Tanabe-mura village.
Based on Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), the Tsuzuki county public office was placed in Tanabe-mura village.

sen.j: - 町村制施行に伴い,綴喜郡に八幡町,美豆村・青谷村・都々城村・有智郷村・田辺村・大住村・普賢寺村・三山木村・草内村・井手村・多賀村・宇治田原村・田原村が成立する。
sen.e: According to the enforcement of municipal organization, one town and thirteen villages, that is Yawata-cho, Mito-mura, Aotani-mura, Tsuzuki-mura, Uchigo-mura, Tanabe-mura, Osumi-mura, Fugenji-mura, Miyamaki-mura, Kusauchi-mura, Ide-mura, Taga-mura, Ujitawara-mura,Tawara-mura were establishd in Tsuzuki-gun.

According to the enforcement of municipal organization, one town and thirteen villages, that is Yawata-cho, Mizu-mura, Aotani-mura, Tsuzuki-mura, Uchigo-mura, Tanabe-mura, Osumi-mura, Fugenji-mura, Miyamaki-mura, Kusauchi-mura, Ide-mura, Taga-mura, Ujitawara-mura,Tawara-mura were establishd in Tsuzuki county.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。Mito-mura → Mizu-mura -gun → county
sen.e: According to the enforcement of municipal organization, one town and thirteen villages, that is Yawata-cho, Mizu-mura, Aotani-mura, Tsuzuki-mura, Uchigo-mura, Tanabe-mura, Osumi-mura, Fugenji-mura, Miyamaki-mura, Kusauchi-mura, Ide-mura, Taga-mura, Ujitawara-mura,Tawara-mura were establishd in Tsuzuki county.
(one town and thirteen villages)
(one town and thirteen villages)
(one town and thirteen villages)

sen.j: - 田辺村が町制施行し田辺町となる。
sen.e: Tanabe-mura became Tanabe-cho according to the enforcement of municipal organization.
Tanabe-mura became Tanabe-cho according to the enforcement of municipal organization.
Tanabe-mura became Tanabe-cho according to the enforcement of municipal organization.
(two towns and twelve villages)
(two towns and twelve villages)
(two towns and twelve villages)

sen.j: - 井手村が町制施行し井手町となる。
sen.e: Ide-mura became Ide-cho according to the enforcement of municipal organization.
Ide-mura became Ide-cho according to the enforcement of municipal organization.
Ide-mura became Ide-cho according to the enforcement of municipal organization.
(three towns and eleven villages)
(three towns and eleven villages)
(three towns and eleven villages)

sen.j: - 美豆村が久世郡淀町に編入。
sen.e: Mito-mura was incorporated into Yodo-cho, Kuse-gun.
Mizu-mura was incorporated into Yodo-cho, Kuse county.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。Mito-mura → Mizu-mura -gun → county
sen.e: Mizu-mura was incorporated into Yodo-cho, Kuse county.
(three towns and ten villages)
(three towns and ten villages)
(three towns and ten villages)

sen.j: - 田辺町に綴喜郡を管轄する綴喜地方事務所を設置。
sen.e: Tsuzuki district office which had jurisdiction over Tsuzuki-gun was established in Tanabe-cho.
Tsuzuki district office which had jurisdiction over Tsuzuki county was established in Tanabe-cho.
Tsuzuki district office which had jurisdiction over Tsuzuki county was established in Tanabe-cho.
April 1, 1951 (three towns and five villages)
April 1, 1951 (three towns and five villages)
April 1, 1951 (three towns and five villages)

sen.j: 普賢寺村・三山木村・草内村・大住村が田辺町に編入。
sen.e: Fugenji-mura, Miyamaki-mura, Kusauchi-mura, and Osumi-mura were incorporated into Tanabe-cho.
Fugenji-mura, Miyamaki-mura, Kusauchi-mura, and Osumi-mura were incorporated into Tanabe-cho.
Fugenji-mura, Miyamaki-mura, Kusauchi-mura, and Osumi-mura were incorporated into Tanabe-cho.

sen.j: 青谷村が久世郡久津川村・富野荘村・寺田村と合併し、久世郡城陽市が発足、郡より離脱。
sen.e: Aotani-mura was merged with Kutsukawa-mura, Tonosho-mura, and Terada-mura, Kuse-gun, and Joyo City to inaugurate Kuse-gun, seceding from the country.
Aotani-mura was merged with three villages from Kuse-gun, Kutsukawa-mura, Tonosho-mura, and Terada-mura to form the city of Joyo, Kuse-gun, and then seceded from the county.
sen.cmt: 意味が不明確だと思ったので再構成しました。スペルミス修正country → county
sen.e: Aotani-mura was merged with three villages from Kuse-gun, Kutsukawa-mura, Tonosho-mura, and Terada-mura to form the city of Joyo, Kuse-gun, and then seceded from the county.

sen.j: - 都々城村・有智郷村が八幡町に編入。
sen.e: Tsuzuki-mura and Uchigo-mura were incorporated into Yawata-cho.
Tsuzuki-mura and Uchigo-mura were incorporated into Yawata-cho.
Tsuzuki-mura and Uchigo-mura were incorporated into Yawata-cho.
(three towns and three villages)
(three towns and three villages)
(three towns and three villages)

sen.j: - 宇治田原村・田原村が合併し、宇治田原町が発足。
sen.e: Ujitawara-mura and Tawara-mura were merged to inaugurate Ujitawara-cho.
Ujitawara-mura and Tawara-mura were merged to inaugurate Ujitawara-cho.
Ujitawara-mura and Tawara-mura were merged to inaugurate Ujitawara-cho.
(four towns and one village)
(four towns and one village)
(four towns and one village)

sen.j: - 井手町・多賀村が合併し、井手町が発足。
sen.e: Ide-cho and Taga VillageIde-cho were merged to inaugurate Ide-cho.
Ide-cho and Taga-mura were merged to inaugurate Ide-cho.
sen.cmt: 不要なテキストを削除しました。
sen.e: Ide-cho and Taga-mura were merged to inaugurate Ide-cho.
(four towns)
(four towns)
(four towns)

sen.j: - 八幡町が市制施行し、八幡市となり郡より離脱。
sen.e: According to enforcement of municipal organization Yawata-cho became Yawata City, seceding from the country
According to enforcement of municipal organization, Yawata-cho became Yawata City and seceded from the county
According to enforcement of municipal organization, Yawata-cho became Yawata City and seceded from the county
(three towns)

sen.j: - 田辺町が市制施行・改称し、京田辺市となり郡より離脱。
sen.e: According to enforcement of municipal organization and changing the name, Tanabe-cho became Kyotanabe City, seceding from the country.
According to enforcement of municipal organization and changing the name, Tanabe-cho became Kyotanabe City and seceded from the county.
According to enforcement of municipal organization and changing the name, Tanabe-cho became Kyotanabe City and seceded from the county.

sen.j: 式内社
sen.e: Shikinai-sha (shrines listed in Engishiki laws)
Shikinai-sha (shrines listed in Engishiki laws)

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳には、山城国綴喜郡に以下の大社3座・小社11座の計14座が記載されている。
sen.e: Engishiki jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan) described the following total of fourteen shrines consisting of three large shrines and eleven small shrines in Yamashiro Province, Tsuzuki-gun.

Engishiki jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan) described the following total of fourteen shrines consisting of three large shrines and eleven small shrines in Yamashiro Province, Tsuzuki county.
